info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 3 at 5:32PM PDT until July 4 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Medford OR
info.description:
* IMPACTS...Given the long stretch of dry and hot conditions, lightning efficiency will be moderate for new fire starts. Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
* AFFECTED AREA...Through 11 PM, the Red Flag covers far eastern portions of fire zone 624, including Bly. Between 11 PM and 7 AM Friday, roughly north of Highway 140 including Modoc Point, Beatty and Chiloquin.
* THUNDERSTORMS...Scattered afternoon and overnight thunderstormsacross the region.
* OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusts up to 45 mph. These outflow winds can travel up to 25 miles away from the thunderstorm that caused it.
* ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...Some storms could be dry with gusty outflows. Also, thunderstorms could continue into Thursday night and early Friday morning. Any overnight storms are more likely to produce significantly less precipitation, or be completely dry.
* DETAILED URL...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction:
Follow all fire restrictions. You can find your county's emergency sign up form as well as links to fire restrictions at weather.gov/medford/wildfire. One less spark, one less wildfire.
Be sure you're signed up for your county's emergency alert system. Familiarize yourself with your emergency plan and make sure you listen to emergency services. Visit ready.gov/plan for more information.
A Red Flag Warning is issued when we identify weather conditions that promote rapid spread of fire which may become life- threatening. This does not mean there is a fire. These conditions are either occurring now or will begin soon. It is important to have multiple ways to receive information from authorities.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT FRIDAY FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING ON DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest
